label: System & Hardware Status
command:
get system status
get hardware status
description: Display general system information (firmware, serial, HA, time, license) and hardware status.

label: TAC Report
description: Generate a Technical Assistance Center (TAC) report for troubleshooting.

label: System Tree
description: Display the configuration tree structure (use within config context).

label: System Control (fnsysctl)
description: Low-level system control commands (use with caution). Examples: fnsysctl cat /proc/meminfo, fnsysctl ifconfig.

label: List Flash Partitions
description: Show the firmware images currently stored on the system's flash partitions.

label: Set Next Boot Partition
description: Select which firmware partition (primary or secondary) to boot from on the next reboot.

label: Reboot System
description: Reboot the Fortigate device.

label: Factory Reset
description: Reset the device to factory default configuration. Optionally shutdown after reset.

label: Factory Reset (Keep Mgmt)
description: Reset to factory defaults but retain admin user, interface IPs, and static routes.

label: Read Config Error Log
description: Show configuration errors logged during startup or after an upgrade.

label: Enter Global VDOM
description: Switch the CLI context to the Global VDOM scope for global settings.

label: Enter Specific VDOM
description: Switch the CLI context to a specific Virtual Domain (VDOM).

label: VDOM Context Commands
description: Run diagnostic, execute, show, or get commands within the current VDOM context. These commands impact only the selected VDOM.

label: Debug WebUI Changes
description: Show the CLI commands generated by changes made in the WebUI (GUI).

label: Enable Console Timestamps
description: Add timestamps to console output messages.

label: Test & Check Logs
command:
diag log test
exec log list
description: Generate test log messages and display the contents of the log buffer.

label: System Performance
command:
get system performance status
diag sys top <delay_seconds> <iterations>
description: Show overall system performance (CPU, memory, sessions) and detailed process usage (like Linux top).

label: Execute Top
description: Alternative command to display real-time process usage (similar to diag sys top).

label: CPU Info
description: Display detailed information about the system's CPU(s).

label: Conserve Mode Info
description: Show memory and file descriptor usage relative to conserve mode thresholds.

label: Memory Info
description: Display memory size and current utilization details.

label: Hardware Test Suite
description: Run a suite of hardware diagnostic tests (available on newer models).

label: Disk Device Info
description: List detected disk drives and their partitions.

label: List Disks (Exec)
description: List disk drives and partitions, showing usage and status.

label: Scan Disk
description: Run a check operation on the specified disk.

label: Format Disk
description: Format the specified disk or partition (requires reboot).

label: Format Log Disk
description: Format the disk partition specifically used for logging (requires reboot).

label: Disable Auto ASIC Offload (Policy)
command:
config firewall policy
 edit <id>
  set auto-asic-offload disable
 end
description: Disable session offloading to hardware (NP/SP) for a specific firewall policy.

label: Disable NPU Offload (VPN)
command:
config vpn ipsec phase1-interface
 edit <name>
  set npu-offload disable
 end
description: Disable VPN encryption/decryption offloading to NPU for a specific IPsec phase1.

label: HQIP Image
description: Hardware Quick Inspection Package (HQIP) is a bootable image used to test hardware components for faults.

label: Daemon Debugging
command:
diag debug application <daemon_name> <level>
diag debug enable
description: Enable debugging for specific FortiOS daemons (e.g., ike, httpsd, fnbamd). Level typically -1 or 255 for maximum detail.

label: Application Test
description: Run built-in tests or monitor operations for specific applications/daemons (e.g., urlfilter, dnsproxy, ipsmonitor).

label: Session Commands
description: Manage the session table: filter entries, list active sessions (optionally use 'expect' for established TCP), clear sessions, show statistics.

label: Clear IP Reputation Counters
command:
diag firewall iprope clear
diag firewall iprope clear <policy_id>
description: Reset counters associated with IP reputation database lookups, either globally or for a specific policy.

label: Debug Flow
command:
diag debug flow filter <options>
diag debug flow show iprop enable
diag debug flow show function-name enable
diag debug flow trace start <count>
description: Trace the processing steps of individual packets through the Fortigate engine. Filter traffic, enable function names, and start tracing.

label: Packet Sniffer
description: Capture packets on a specific interface. Use filters (e.g., 'host 1.1.1.1'), verbosity (1-6), packet count, and timestamp format (a, l).

label: Traffic Test (Iperf)
command:
diag traffictest server-intf <intf>
diag traffictest client-intf <intf>
diag traffictest port <port_num>
diag traffictest run -c <server_ip>
description: Run an iperf network bandwidth test directly from the Fortigate, acting as either a client or server.

label: List Network Interfaces (Kernel)
description: Show network interfaces as seen by the underlying kernel.

label: Hardware NIC Details
description: Display hardware details for a specific network interface (port).

label: Interface IP Config (fnsysctl)
description: Low-level command to view interface IP configuration (similar to Linux ifconfig).

label: Interface Transceiver Info
command:
get system interface physical
get system interface transceiver
description: Show physical layer details for copper interfaces or SFP/transceiver information (vendor, serial, diagnostics).

label: List Interface IPs
description: List all IP addresses configured on the Fortigate's interfaces.

label: List VIP/IP Pool IPs
description: Show the IP addresses associated with Virtual IPs (VIPs) and IP Pools.

label: ARP Table Management
command:
get system arp
diag ip arp list
exec clear system arp table
description: View the system ARP table (IP to MAC mappings) and clear it.

label: Bridge MAC Table
description: Display the MAC address table for a software switch (bridge) interface.

label: IPsec Tunnel List (Simple)
description: Show a basic list of configured IPsec tunnels.

label: IPsec Tunnel Details
description: Display detailed configuration and status information for a specific IPsec tunnel.

label: IPsec Tunnel Statistics
command:
get vpn ipsec tunnel summary
get vpn ipsec stats tunnel
description: Show summary statistics (status, uptime) and detailed statistics (bytes, packets, errors) for IPsec tunnels.

label: IPsec Crypto Status
description: Shows the status of IPsec cryptographic operations and offloading.

label: Debug IKE
command:
diag debug application ike -1
diag debug enable
diag vpn ike log filter <options>
description: Enable detailed debugging for IKE (Phase 1) negotiation. Use filters to narrow down output.

label: IKE Gateway List (Phase 1)
description: Show the status and statistics of IKE (Phase 1) Security Associations (SAs).

label: IPsec Tunnel List (Phase 2)
description: Show the status and statistics of IPsec (Phase 2) Security Associations (SAs).

label: Flush IKE Gateway (Phase 1)
description: Tear down and delete a specific IKE (Phase 1) SA.

label: Flush IPsec Tunnel (Phase 2)
description: Tear down and delete a specific IPsec (Phase 2) SA.

label: SD-WAN Member Details
command:
diag sys sdwan member
diag system virtual-wan-link member
description: Show details about SD-WAN member interfaces. Use 'virtual-wan-link' for FortiOS <= 6.2.

label: SD-WAN Health Check Status
command:
diag sys sdwan health-check
diag system virtual-wan-link health-check
description: Display the status of SD-WAN health checks (performance SLAs). Use 'virtual-wan-link' for FortiOS <= 6.2.

label: SD-WAN Service Rule Info
command:
diag sys sdwan service <rule_id>
diag system virtual-wan-link service <rule_id>
description: Display details and statistics for a specific SD-WAN rule (service). Use 'virtual-wan-link' for FortiOS <= 6.2.

label: SD-WAN Interface SLA Log
command:
diag sys sdwan intf-sla-log <member_id>
diag system virtual-wan-link intf-sla-log <member_id>
description: Show historical SLA performance data for a specific SD-WAN member interface. Use 'virtual-wan-link' for FortiOS <= 6.2.

label: SD-WAN SLA Log (Detailed)
command:
diag sys sdwan sla-log <health_check_name> <member_id>
diag system virtual-wan-link sla-log <health_check_name> <member_id>
description: Show detailed SLA logs for a specific health check on a specific member interface. Use 'virtual-wan-link' for FortiOS <= 6.2.

label: SD-WAN Link Monitor Stats
description: Display statistics related to the link monitoring daemon (used by SD-WAN/virtual-wan-link).

label: SD-WAN Link Monitor Debug
command:
diag debug application link-monitor -1
diag debug enable
description: Enable detailed debugging for the link monitoring daemon.

label: Routing Table (All/Details)
command:
get router info routing-table all
get router info routing-table details <ip_address>
description: Display the entire routing table or detailed information for routes matching a specific destination IP.

label: Routing Table Database
description: Show the routing table including inactive routes (routes not currently selected as best).

label: Kernel Routing Table (FIB)
description: Display the Forwarding Information Base (FIB), the routing table actually used by the kernel for forwarding packets.

label: List Policy Routes
description: Show configured policy-based routes.

label: List Route Cache
description: Display the route cache, showing recently used destination lookups.

label: Routing Protocol Info
description: Show general information about configured dynamic routing protocols.

label: Restart Routing Daemon
description: Restart the routing daemon process (routed).

label: Link Monitor Status (LLB)
command:
diag sys link-monitor status
diag sys link-monitor intf
diag sys link-monitor launch
description: Show the status of link monitors used for WAN Link Load Balancing (WAN LLB).

label: BGP Summary/Neighbors
command:
get router info bgp summary
get router info bgp neighbors
description: Display BGP summary information and the status of BGP neighbors.

label: OSPF Status/Interface/Neighbor/DB
command:
get router info ospf status
get router info ospf interface
get router info ospf neighbor
get router info ospf database
description: Display OSPF status, interface details, neighbor adjacencies, and the Link State Database (LSDB).

label: Debug BGP/OSPF
command:
diag ip router bgp all enable
diag ip router ospf all enable
diag ip router bgp level info
diag ip router ospf level info
diag debug enable
description: Enable real-time debugging for BGP or OSPF protocols. Set level to 'info' for less verbose output.

label: Clear BGP/OSPF Session
command:
exec router clear bgp all
exec router clear ospf process
description: Reset BGP sessions or the OSPF process.

label: HA Status & Management
command:
get system ha status
exec ha manage <index | username>
description: Display High Availability status and manage login access to cluster members.

label: HA Event History
description: Show the history of High Availability events (failovers, sync issues, etc.).

label: HA Cluster Uptime
command:
diag sys ha dump-by vcluster
diag sys ha dump-by memory
description: Show uptime and basic status information for cluster members.

label: Reset HA Uptime
description: Reset the uptime counter for HA cluster members.

label: Debug HA Communication
command:
diag debug application hatalk -1
diag debug application hasync -1
diag debug enable
description: Enable detailed debugging for HA heartbeat (hatalk) and synchronization (hasync) processes.

label: HA Ignore Hardware Revision
description: Allow HA cluster formation even if members have different hardware revisions (use with caution).

label: HA Failover Status & Force
command:
exec ha failover status
exec ha failover set <device_id>
description: Check the failover status and manually force a failover to a specific device regardless of conditions.

label: HA Checksum
command:
diag sys ha checksum cluster
diag sys ha checksum show <vdom_name>
diag sys ha checksum recalculate
description: Show HA configuration checksums to verify synchronization status. Recalculate if needed.

label: ISDB Info Lookup
description: Show details about a specific Internet Service Database (ISDB) entry.

label: ISDB Reverse Lookup (IP/Port)
description: Perform a reverse lookup in the ISDB based on IP address, protocol, and port.

label: ISDB Reverse Lookup (IP Match)
description: Perform a reverse lookup in the ISDB for a specific IP address.

label: Dump FQDN Cache
description: Display the contents of the FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name) object cache.

label: List FQDN Objects
description: List all configured FQDN address objects and their currently resolved IP addresses.

label: Update Device Detection DB
description: Manually trigger an update for the device detection (source visibility) database.

label: List/Clear Detected Devices
command:
diag user device list
diag user device clear
description: Show the list of devices detected on the network by the Fortigate, or clear the list.

label: FortiGuard URLs
description: Key FortiGuard service URLs: upgrade.fortiguard.net, service.fortiguard.net, securefw.fortiguard.net.

label: Autoupdate Status & Versions
command:
diag autoupdate status
diag autoupdate versions
description: Show the status of FortiGuard update connections and the versions of installed UTM packages (AV, IPS, etc.).

label: Debug & Trigger Updates
command:
diag debug application update -1
diag debug enable
exec update-now
description: Enable debugging for the update process and manually trigger an update check.

label: AV Database Info
description: Display detailed information about the loaded Antivirus database.

label: AV Engine Test
description: Run internal tests for the Antivirus engine (e.g., 'eicar', 'info').

label: IPS Anomaly Statistics
description: Show statistics related to IPS DoS (Denial of Service) policies.

label: IPS Packet Statistics
description: Display statistics about packets processed by the IPS engine.

label: IPS Engine Enable/Disable
description: Toggle the IPS engine enable/disable state (temporary, for testing).

label: IPS Toggle Bypass Status
description: Toggle the IPS engine bypass status (temporary, for testing).

label: IPS Restart Processes
description: Restart all IPS-related processes.

label: WF/Antispam Rating Servers Info
description: Show information about connected FortiGuard Web Filter and Antispam rating servers.

label: Web Filter FortiGuard Stats
description: Display statistics about requests made to FortiGuard for web filtering ratings.

label: Web Filter Cache Dump
description: Show the contents of the FortiGuard Web Filter rating cache.

label: Web Filter Test Commands List
description: List available test commands for the URL filter process.

label: Debug Web Filter
command:
diag debug urlfilter src-addr <ip_address>
diag debug application urlfilter -1
diag debug enable
description: Enable detailed debugging for the web filter process, optionally filtering by source IP.

label: SIP Session Helper Status
description: Show the status of the SIP session helper.

label: SIP ALG Session Status
description: Display status and statistics for the SIP Application Layer Gateway (ALG).

label: List/Clear SIP Calls
command:
diag sys sip-proxy calls list
diag sys sip-proxy calls clear
description: List active SIP calls processed by the ALG, or clear the call list.

label: Debug SIP
command:
diag debug application sip -1
diag debug enable
description: Enable real-time debugging for SIP traffic processing.

label: Filter Authenticated Users
description: Set filters for viewing the authenticated user list (e.g., by source IP, username).

label: List Authenticated Users
description: Show the list of currently authenticated users (firewall authentication).

label: Test Authentication Server
command:
diag test authserver ldap <server_name> <username> <password>
diag test authserver radius <server_name> <username> <password>
description: Test connectivity and authentication against configured LDAP or RADIUS servers.

label: Debug Auth Protocol
command:
diag debug application auth -1
diag debug enable
description: Enable debugging for general authentication protocols.

label: Debug Remote Auth (fnbamd)
command:
diag debug application fnbamd -1
diag debug enable
description: Enable debugging specifically for remote authentication protocols handled by the fnbamd daemon (LDAP, RADIUS, etc.).

label: Filter FSSO User List
description: Set filters for viewing the FSSO authenticated user list.

label: List FSSO Authenticated Users
description: Show the list of users currently authenticated via Fortinet Single Sign-On (FSSO).

label: List FSSO Collector Agents
description: Show the status of connected FSSO Collector Agents.

label: FSSO Polling Info
description: Display information related to clientless polling mode FSSO.

label: Debug FSSO Polling
command:
diag debug application fssoad -1
diag debug enable
description: Enable debugging for clientless FSSO polling mode.

label: List/Clear Explicit Proxy Users
command:
diag wad user list
diag wad user clear
description: List or clear users currently connected through the explicit web proxy.

label: Filter Explicit Proxy Sessions
description: Set filters for viewing explicit web proxy sessions (e.g., by source IP, user, destination).

label: List Explicit Proxy Sessions
description: Display active explicit web proxy sessions.

label: Explicit Proxy DNS Stats
description: Show DNS statistics related to the explicit web proxy.

label: Explicit Proxy Current Users
description: Display currently active users connected via the explicit proxy.

label: Explicit Proxy Debug Output Enable
description: Enable verbose output for subsequent 'diag test application wad' commands.

label: Explicit Proxy Max Users
description: Show the maximum number of concurrent users supported by the explicit proxy.

label: Show Traffic Shapers
description: Display configured traffic shapers (shared and policy-based).

label: List Per-IP Traffic Shapers
description: Show the status and usage of per-IP traffic shapers.

label: QTM chip counters
description: QTM chip counters, if empty, then no shaping by QTM

label: npu ipsec drop counters
description: check for ipsec  drop counters in NP7 level : diag npu np7 dce-ipsec-drop <npu_id> <action>
